cab.content: (This Document is the ProperHis Britannic Majesty's Govern.-:';;Circulated by the Secretary of State for India.is^j) From Viceroy, Foreign and Political Department -Sy 3rd September 1917.(Received at India Office, 10.15 p.m.)Secret. Weekly Report. Frontier quiet, except in Kuram, where Jabis renewed attack on Turis, wounding three, but were driven back with loss of eight killed and five wounded. They have since dispersed, but Mangal lashkar has gathered. Afghan commandant reported to have forbidden attack, and reported affair to Kabul.No change in the general military situation in India or Afghanistan.
